data.title: Great Every Time
data.text:
As vegetarians, we look for places that have more than three things we can eat on the menu. Mooney's has a menu full of options for us, vegans and meat eaters. 
The beer and wine lists are excellent. The vinho verde with the lentil stew is my goto meal many nights. My husband likes the make your own platter option. 
The service is always outstanding, the food always consistent. 
Chicken, beef or tempeh; there's something for everyone and it's all very good.

data.title: Great fresh hand made Mediterranean food!
data.text: Mooney and his team throw down some fantastic hand made food. It's sourced locally, organically, and treated with pride and respect for the craft. The counter staff are friendly and helpful offering new ideas with each visit. It's got a decent interior but sit outside if the weather is right to enjoy the passersby! This is my go to lunch spot in downtown Winston-Salem!

data.title: Love this place
data.text: I've been to Mooney's many times, and it's always a good experience.  The service staff is good and friendly and the food is dependable.

data.title: Lunchtime eats
data.text: I love the lentil soup and the Jezebel pita. The food is cooked upon order and the wait is not long at all.

data.title: Wonderful food and good service
data.text:
My family and I love this place.  Every time we pass by we stop here.

The flafel is fantastic, baba ganoush, hummus, tawook - just go, you won't regret it.

Mooney is a gracious host and his staff are friendly and quick with service.

data.title: Best, best, BEST!
data.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants anywhere. As a vegetarian, they serve a nice variety of meat-free dishes, all delicious! The staff are all fantastic and the place is charming. It's the best!

data.title: Casual
data.text: Would certainly return for more. Enjoyed every bit of it. The dishes also have a hint of Indian spices and a wealth of fulfilling satisfaction. Thanks Mooney's!!

data.title: Great, hand-made, authentic food.
data.text: Mooney's is one of my go-to lunch places in Winston-Salem. The staff is friendly and attentive and the food is outstanding. Mooney is usually at the counter ready to give advice on the menu and is proud of the hand-made, locally sourced (including local beef, etc.) and the food is ccoked fresh to order.

data.title: Stop and think before you eat
data.text: Stopped here because of all the good reviews. Wife got a Ace Falaffle and I got Sawarma pita or what I would call Gryo. 1st that is not Sawarma, Sawarma is meat on a spit that's been roasting for hours and hours. This is some kind of meat in a vinegar base of some kind (crap). Next I took a bit of my french fries and one tasted l like mold. My wife just did n I t lie hers. After reading reviews I'm now guessing that staff and friends must have worked up the reviews. Eater beware.

data.title: Terrible Customer Service
data.text: I had received glowing reviews from 2 couples so we decided to dine at Mooney's before heading to the Summer on Liberty concert with another couple.  The restaurant was empty at 6 p.m. on a Saturday night, but we noticed up the street that King's Crab Shack and the tai restaurant were booming with customers.  Our waitress (who had gorgeous red curly hair) took our order and that was the last time we saw her.  We did notice her later outside on her cell phone.  Our orders were delivered by another employee and immediately we noticed there was an error with one order.  I ordered the Falafel Burger which was good.  For my side, I ordered Jeweled Cous Cous and it was not very tasty.  My husband ordered the Jezebel Pita and he said it was very good, but they brought him the wrong side order - Hummus instead of Baba Ghanouj.  After waiting an unusually long amount of time, the Baba Ghanouj was delivered and it was very bland and not flavorful.  We can live with the food not being to our liking, but it's hard to forgive Mooney's for bad customer service.  The employees were MIA most of the time we were there, and there are too many good restaurants within a stone's throw that offer exceptional service so we won't be going back to Mooney's.  We were very disappointed.

data.title: Good food, kid friendly
data.text: Enjoyed apps, entrees and brews... kids also had a great time and we're well taken care of by waitstaff.

data.title: Nice Saturday dinner
data.text: Had dinner here with my daughter on a Saturday evening.  It was a bit later so it wasn't crowded at all.  The service was very friendly and prompt.  The menu was good with plenty of choices.  They were out of the tabouli, which was what my daughter wanted.  Apparently a big crowd ordered all they had earlier in the day.  I had the ace of falafel pita with lentil soup.  My daughter had the traditional falafel pita with fettoosh.  My pita had grilled vegetables.  Thankfully the falafel was not too spicy for me.  It was hard to eat and I eventually used a fork but it was very good.  I enjoyed the lentil soup as well.  My daughter enjoyed her dinner as well.  The price was very reasonable for the amount of food we got.

data.title: Great food, good price, local ingredients and local beer.
data.text: The food is amazing. I loved the kafta and the falafel. Good service. Very fast. The variety of local beers is good and for 4 dollars. The ingredients as local and they have vegetarian options.

data.title: Can't miss in Winston
data.text:
This is my favorite place to dine in Winston.  I love the friendly atmosphere and the traditional Lebanese food is to die for.  The falafel, the hummus, the tawook - it's all fantastic.

Recommended without reservation!!!

data.title: Ok
data.text:
I love Mediterranean cuisine, and had high expectations. I am a bit of a food snob, so maybe my opinion is not the best, but I found the taste to be average.
As well, I wish that there was ethnic music playing.

data.title: Super value, yummy food, popular takeout.
data.text: In downtown Winston on a Saturday noon a lot of places are closed; this was a freak find for us. We have eaten Lebanese diaspora food from Kuwait through London and Montreal to the US south, and this is about the best value for money. Mezze outstanding. Moussaka (eggplant, chick pea soupy version) great. Nice coffee in insulated pression pots. Freshest falafel. Bill about $20 for two.  They were doing a roaring takeout business- some orders looked like they were for a dozen people.  Nice plain corner site with some tables outside. I doubt they need our review, but we are grateful for a good meal.

data.title: One of the best things about Winston-Salem
data.text: Consistently delicious food and great service. I've been dozens of times and am never disappointed, it's our go-to place in town.

data.title: Our favorite local stop for Mediterranean cuisine
data.text: We love Mooney's! In spite of that, we only get there a few times a year, but we are never disappointed. We brought friends with us on our latest visit and truly enjoyed good company, great food, and a table by the street. As usual, I ordered the sampler platter of Fetoosh (salad), fried cauliflower (the best anywhere, ever), couscous, and the most decadent hummus. My husband had the Shawarma chicken platter and we shared the tabouli and falafel. I can't say enough good things about their falafel -- deeply crispy on the outside and light and moist inside. I could literally bathe in the tahini sauce, it is THAT good. We always overeat but never feel overstuffed. The staff is friendly and outgoing. Wish we lived closer to downtown -- I'd be getting takeout several times a week!

data.title: Just walked in and got a delicious lunch with a smile
data.text: Didn't really know what I ordered, but it was a Mediterranean wrap with beef and it was terrific.  Helpful and pleasant service

data.title: A Vegan Go To
data.text: Being Vegan its always tough to visit new places. It was great to find this restraint with amazing vegan options in a sea of southern style meat only ventures.
